newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo naphtha edges up on firmer European market.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo naphtha edges up on firmer European market.

text.p: Tokyo naphtha prices edged higher in afternoon trade on Friday, taking support from the firmer European naphtha market, traders said.
"There were no fresh incentives in today's market except for stronger naphtha in Europe," one dealer said.
Open-spec naphtha for second-half July was assessed at $216.50/217.50 per tonne, up from Thursday's $216.00/217.25.
First-half August was quoted at $217.50/218.50. It was rumoured to have been traded at $217.25 on Thursday.
In spreads, the near-term contango continued to narrow, with 2nd-half July/2nd-half August quoted at minus $1.00/even.
It was traded at minus $1.50 on Thursday.
Spreads from first-half August onwards have turned into backwardation, traders said.
In the low sulphur waxy residue (LSWR) market, Japan will import at least three cargoes, or about 1.2 million barrels, of Indonesian cargoes for June delivery, traders said.
Offer levels for June cargoes were nominally assessed at 30 to 40 cents per barrel over the Pertamina formula, against bids at the formula plus about 20 cents.
